document.docAuthor: Tan, Jiang-Li, Achterberg, Cornelis Van, He, Yi-Fei & Carpenter, James M.
document.docTitle: Allorhynchium van der Vecht, comb. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Northeast Asian Allorhynchium van der Vecht (Hymenoptera: Vespidae), with a key to Oriental species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Northeast Asian Allorhynchium van der Vecht (Hymenoptera: Vespidae), with a key to Oriental species

heading.emphasis:
Key to Oriental species of
Allorhynchium van der Vecht

keyStep.keyLead:
1 T1 with distinct transverse rim medio-laterally ( Figs 29, 30 ); clypeus vermiculate-reticulate ( Fig. 31 ); tegula, clypeus of ♀ , inter-antennal area, pronotum anteriorly, metanotum, mesepisternum dorsally and propodeum laterally, yellow ( Figs 1, 2 ); S7 of ♂ with 3 small teeth basally (
Fig. 44
in Giordani Soika, 1986b ); [T2 densely punctate or reticulate basally]; China ( Sichuan , Fujian )............................................................
A. diffinis (Giordani Soika, 1986)
comb. n.

- T1 more or less evenly rounded medio-laterally ( Figs 42, 43 , 52 ), but intermediate in some species, e.g.
A. quadrimaculatum
( Fig. 59 ); clypeus punctate ( Fig. 62 ), sometimes reticulate rugose-punctate ( Fig. 53 ); tegula black or reddish brown; clypeus of ♀ , inter-antennal area, pronotum anteriorly, metanotum, mesepisternum dorsally and propodeum laterally, black ( Fig. 4 ); S7 of ♂ either with 2 small teeth basally ( Fig. 64 ) or with only a shiny and flat elevation ( Figs 16 , 44 )....................... 2

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Occipital carina wide laterally ( Fig. 13 ); medio-dorsally propodeum with serrate crest protruding above medial depression ( Fig. 19 ); propodeum deeply concave and strongly shiny medially ( Figs 15 , 23 ); clypeus of ♂ entirely black; smooth area on S7 of ♂ distinctly protruding postero-ventrally ( Fig. 16 ); China (Sichuan, Taiwan; Guangzhou, Macao, Jiangxi (NWUX), Shanghai, *Henan (NWUX), *Fujian (RMNH)), Vietnam,?Philippines ( fide Marco Selis: the presence of this species in the Philippines is quite doubtful and could be a misidentification of
A. violaceipenne
or an undescribed species common in many islands of the archipelago)......................................................
A. chinense (de Saussure, 1862 )

- Occipital carina medium-sized laterally ( Figs 41 , 50 , 57 ); medio-dorsally propodeum not protruding above medial depression ( Figs 47 , 59 ), at most with a serrate margin ( Fig. 7 ); propodeum shallowly to moderately concave and with satin sheen medially ( Figs 7 , 43 , 55 , 59 ); clypeus of ♂ often partly ivory or yellowish; smooth area on S7 of ♂ often slightly protruding postero-ventrally ( Fig. 8 )................................................................................ 3

3 Clypeus with narrow V-shaped or circular medio-apical emargination and wide apico-lateral lobes ( Fig. 66 ); clypeus of ♂ with pale yellowish longitudinal band and remainder black; veins and membrane of basal half of fore wing yellowish; vertex of ♀ with tuft of setae in small depression (“cephalic fovea’) medio-dorsally; [T1 and T2 black apically]; Indonesia ( Java )..................................................................................
A. concolor van der Vecht, 1963

- Clypeus broadly emarginated and with apico-lateral lobes or teeth narrow ( Figs 67–69 ) or truncate ( Figs 70, 71 ) apically; clypeus of ♂ variable, often with pale yellowish transverse band basally; colour of veins and membrane of basal half of fore wing variable; vertex of ♀ often without setose cephalic fovea (but present in
A. violaceipenne
,
A. obscurum
,
A. vollenhoveni
and
A. cariniventre
).................................................................................... 4

4 Lateral areas of pronotum in dorsal view flattened and with distinct protuberance laterally; T1 rather angulate in lateral view; vertex of ♀ with tuft of setae in small cephalic fovea medio-dorsally............................................ 5

- Lateral areas of pronotum in dorsal view convex and at most slightly protruding laterally; T1 often rounded in lateral view; vertex of ♀ often without tuft of setae in small cephalic fovea medio-dorsally (but present in
A. obscurum
and
A. violaceipenne
);.............................................................................................. 6

- Veins and membrane of fore wing entirely fuscous with metallic reflections; clypeal emargination medio-dorsally curved because of small lobe (
Fig. 2
in Gusenleitner, 1998 ); Philippines ...................
A. cariniventre Giordani Soika, 1986

- Dorsal half of propodeal depression largely glabrous; clypeus protruding latero-apically ( Figs 45 , 62 , 69 ); T1 black or with pair of yellow patches apically; wings usually largely dark brown with bluish iridescence; head and mesosoma usually moderately punctate............................................................................................. 7

7 Clypeus of both sexes squarely and usually rather deeply emarginate, resulting in two widely separated teeth or narrow lobes apico-ventrally ( Figs 67–69 ); width of clypeal emargination 0.5–0.7 × clypeal width at same level; clypeus of ♂ entirely black; S7 of ♂ with flat and apically nearly truncate smooth protruding area; [T1 rather angulate in lateral view]............... 8

- Clypeus of both sexes circularly or elliptically emarginated apically, resulting in pair of less separated lobes or teeth apico-ventrally ( Figs 9 , 45 , 62 ); width of clypeal emargination 0.2–0.5 × clypeal width at same level; clypeus colour and shape of S7 of ♂ variable........................................................................................... 9

8 Clypeus shallowly emarginate medio-apically; vertex with narrow transverse and slightly raised impunctate area behind posterior ocelli; metasoma relatively coarsely punctate; Philippines ..............
A. quadrituberculatum (von Schulthess, 1913 )

- Clypeus distinctly emarginate medio-apically, straight or nearly so (( Fig. 3 e, f in van der Vecht 1963 , Figs 67–69 ); vertex without transverse and slightly raised impunctate area medio-dorsally; metasoma moderately punctate; [hind wing hyaline in the basal half; punctures on dorsal faces of propodeum relatively sparse; Vietnam , Indonesia (Sunda area), Philippines ; [syn.:
Odynerus aurivillianus von Schulthess, 1913
].......................................
A. snelleni (de Saussure, 1862 )

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note. For a key to the three subspecies i.e. A. s.
snelleni (de Saussure)
, A. s. javanum (de Saussure) and A. s. imitator van der Vecht, see van der Vecht (1963)

9 Scapus and pedicellus, all femora and tibiae, and two large spots on propodeum reddish brown; subbasal area of S7 of ♂ flat; [apex of T1 and T2 with yellow or dull reddish yellow band (sometimes medially interrupted); clypeus of ♂ largely black, at most with two transverse yellowish spots basally]; Indonesia (Sunda area), Timor, Sumba...
A. tigrinum van der Vecht, 1963

Note. For the two subspecies i.e. T. t.
tigrinum van der Vecht
and T. t. atripenne Giordani Soika, see Giordani Soika (1986a , 1991 )
- Scapus and pedicellus, all femora and tibiae, and propodeum black; subbasal area of S7 of ♂ partly elevated............ 10

paragraph.keyLead:
10 Posterior half of T1 and basal half of T2 of ♀ at most sparsely punctulate ( Fig. 52 ), of ♂ superficially punctate (
Figs 42
, 4 3 ).................................................................................................... 11

11 Medial length of clypeus 0.9 × its maximum width ( Fig. 45 ); depth of emargination 0.2–0.3 × width of clypeus at level of emargination ( Fig. 45 ); Pakistan , India , Sri Lanka , Maldives , Nepal , Myanmar , Malaysia (N. Borneo), Indonesia ( Moluccas ), China ( Taiwan , * Tibet ( NWUX ), * Yunnan ( NWUX )); [syn.:
Rhynchium maldivense Cameron, 1901
].............................................................................................
A. metallicum (de Saussure, 1852 )

-... Medial length of clypeus 1.1 × its maximum width; depth of emargination 0.1 × width of clypeus at level of emargination; Philippines ...............................................................
A. violaceipenne Gusenleitner, 2003

12 Clypeus of ♂ with a tuberculate projection near its apical half (
Fig. 3
in
Girish Kumar et al ., 2016
); basally clypeus of ♂ with a narrow transverse yellowish white band; India ( Kerala ); [ ♀ unknown]...
A. tuberculatum Girish Kumar & Carpenter, 2016
- Clypeus of ♂ without any projection ( Figs 9 , 62 ); clypeus of ♂ without more or less separate basal pale band ( Figs 9 , 62 ).. 13

keyStep.keyLead:
13 Antero-dorsal surface of propodeum almost at same level as dorsal surface of metanotum and scutellum ( Figs 6, 7 ); protruding subbasal area of S7 of ♂ subparallel-sided and wide medially ( Fig. 8 ); [gena densely silvery setose ( Fig. 6 ); clypeus of ♀ with rather deep and wide emargination apically ( Fig. 8 ); clypeus of ♂ densely silvery setose ( Fig. 9 ) and more or less with a yel- lowish pattern]; Pakistan , India , Nepal , Myanmar , Thailand , Laos , Malaysia , Singapore , Indonesia (Sunda area & Sulawesi ), Philippines ; [syn.:
Rhynchium clypeatum Cameron, 1900
]............................
A. argentatum ( Fabricius, 1804 )

- Antero-dorsal surface of propodeum well below dorsal surface of metanotum and scutellum ( Figs 57–59 ); protruding subbasal area of S7 of ♂ either wide and medially constricted, with pair of flat lobe-shaped protuberances (
Fig. 12
in Girish Kumar & Sharma 2015 ) or with pair of triangular teeth ( Fig. 64 )....................................................... 14

paragraph.keyLead:
14 T2 (as T1) entirely black apically; clypeus of ♂ entirely black; protruding smooth subbasal area of S7 of ♂ wide and medially constricted (
Fig. 12
in
Girish Kumar et al . 2016
); wings moderately infuscate ( Fig. 7 l.c .); T1 finely punctate anteriorly; [junction of anterior and dorsal faces of T1 rather angulate]; India (Kerala).................
A. anomalum Giordani Soika, 1992

15 Subbasal area of S7 of ♂ with pair of triangular teeth ( Fig. 64 ); transverse rim at junction of anterior and dorsal faces of T1 present ( Figs 4 , 59 ); clypeus moderately punctate medially ( Fig. 62 ); Laos , * Vietnam ......................................................................................................
A. quadrimaculatum Gusenleitner, 1997

-
Subbasal area of S7 of ♂ with pair of flat lobe-shaped protuberances (
Fig. 12
in Girish Kumar & Sharma 2015 ); transverse rim at junction of anterior and dorsal faces of T1 absent ( Fig. 37 ); clypeus rugose-punctate medially ( Fig. 38 ); [apex of T1 and T2 with yellow or dull reddish yellow band (sometimes medially interrupted)]; India ( Meghalaya , Sikkim )
,
China (* Yunnan )..............................................................................
A. lugubrinum ( Cameron, 1900 )
